titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Adaline Millard letter to Rachel Ann Mudgley 1974.242
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:42 +0000.

did.unittitle: Adaline Millard letter to Rachel Ann Mudgley
did.abstract: A letter from Adaline Millard of Babylon, Long Island to Rachel Ann Mudgley of New York, requesting Mudgley and her husband to come visit Millard and her family. Dated 1852.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Adaline Millard letter to Rachel Ann Mudgley, 1974.242, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1974.
